00029 qp_solver::qp_solver(
00030         const int N_, 
00031         const double Alpha, 
00032         const double Beta, 
00033         const double Gamma, 
00034         const double regularization, 
00035         const double tol_) :
00036     problem_parameters (N_, Alpha, Beta, Gamma, regularization) 
00037 {
00038     tol = tol_;
00039 
00040     gain_alpha = Alpha;
00041     gain_beta  = Beta;
00042     gain_gamma = Gamma;
00043 
00044     dX = new double[NUM_VAR*N]();
00045 }

00047 
00058 void qp_solver::form_init_fp (
00059         const double *x_coord, 
00060         const double *y_coord, 
00061         const double *X_tilde,
00062         double* X_)
00063 {
00064     X = X_;
00065 
00066     double *control = &X[NUM_STATE_VAR*N];
00067     double *cur_state = X;
00068     const double *prev_state = X_tilde;
00069 
00070     
00071     for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00072     {
00073         //------------------------------------
00074         /* inv(Cp*B). This is a [2 x 2] diagonal matrix (which is invertible if T^3/6-h*T is
00075          * not equal to zero). The two elements on the main diagonal are equal, and only one of them 
00076          * is stored, which is equal to
00077             1/(T^3/6 - h*T)
00078          */
00079         double iCpB = 1/(spar[i].B[0]);
00080 
00081         /* inv(Cp*B)*Cp*A. This is a [2 x 6] matrix with the following structure
00082             iCpB_CpA = [a b c 0 0 0;
00083                         0 0 0 a b c];
00084 
00085             a = iCpB
00086             b = iCpB*T
00087             c = iCpB*T^2/2
00088          * Only a,b and c are stored.
00089          */
00090         double iCpB_CpA[3] = {iCpB, iCpB*spar[i].A3, iCpB*spar[i].A6};
00091         //------------------------------------
00092 
00093 
00094         control[0] = -iCpB_CpA[0]*prev_state[0] - iCpB_CpA[1]*prev_state[1] - iCpB_CpA[2]*prev_state[2] + iCpB*x_coord[i];
00095         control[1] = -iCpB_CpA[0]*prev_state[3] - iCpB_CpA[1]*prev_state[4] - iCpB_CpA[2]*prev_state[5] + iCpB*y_coord[i];
00096 
00097         cur_state[0] = prev_state[0] + spar[i].A3*prev_state[1] + spar[i].A6*prev_state[2] + spar[i].B[0]*control[0];
00098         cur_state[1] =                            prev_state[1] + spar[i].A3*prev_state[2] + spar[i].B[1]*control[0];
00099         cur_state[2] =                                                       prev_state[2] + spar[i].B[2]*control[0];
00100         cur_state[3] = prev_state[3] + spar[i].A3*prev_state[4] + spar[i].A6*prev_state[5] + spar[i].B[0]*control[1];
00101         cur_state[4] =                            prev_state[4] + spar[i].A3*prev_state[5] + spar[i].B[1]*control[1];
00102         cur_state[5] =                                                       prev_state[5] + spar[i].B[2]*control[1];
00103 
00104 
00105         prev_state = &X[NUM_STATE_VAR*i];
00106         cur_state = &X[NUM_STATE_VAR*(i+1)];
00107         control = &control[NUM_CONTROL_VAR];
00108     }
00109 
00110 
00111     // go back to bar states
00112     cur_state = X;
00113     for (int i=0; i<N; i++)
00114     {
00115         state_handling::tilde_to_bar (spar[i].sin, spar[i].cos, cur_state);
00116         cur_state = &cur_state[NUM_STATE_VAR];
00117     }
00118 }
